info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 2:58AM MDT until October 12 at 5:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Dona Ana and western Texas, including the following county, El Paso.
* WHEN...Until 500 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Horizon City, Clint, Fabens, Tornillo, Hueco Tanks, Anthony, Santa Teresa, Sunland Park and San Elizario. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
